info.title: Auvik API
info.description:
To use the Auvik APIs, you’ll need a valid Auvik user and the user’s API key. The user must also have the correct role permissions.

Note: The word tenant as it appears in the API descriptions means one of Auvik’s supported tenant types: multi-client or client.

All date formats are formatted in the format of YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ, as describe in ISO 8061

To find out more about Auvik’s APIs, click here.

tags.name: Device
tags.description:
The Auvik Device API allows you to view an inventory of devices and other related information discovered by Auvik.

  • Read Multiple Devices’ Info: Pulls detail about multiple devices discovered on your client’s network.
  • Read a Single Device’s Info: Pulls detail about a specific device discovered on your client’s network.
  • Read Multiple Devices’ Details: Pulls details about multiple devices not already included in the Device Info API.
  • Read a Single Device’s Details: Pulls details about a specific device not already included in the Device Info API.
  • Read Multiple Device’s Extended Details: Pulls extended information about multiple devices not already included in the Device Info API.
  • Read a Single Device’s Extended Details: Pulls extended information about a specific device not already included in the Device Info API.
  • Read Multiple Devices’ Warranty Info: Pulls the collected warranty information about the various devices discovered on your client’s network.
  • Read a Single Device’s Warranty Info: Pulls the collected warranty information about a specific device discovered on your client’s network.
  • Read Multiple Devices’ Lifecycle Info: Pulls the lifecycle information about the various devices discovered on your client’s network.
  • Read a Single Device’s Lifecycle Info: Pulls the lifecycle information about a specific device discovered on your client’s network.

tags.name: Network
tags.description:
The Auvik Network API allows you to view an inventory of networks and other related information discovered by Auvik.

There are four endpoints available within the Network API.
  1. Read Multiple Networks’ Details: Pulls extra collected information about multiple discovered networks.
  2. Read a Single Network’s Details: Pulls extra collected information about a specific discovered network.
  3. Read Multiple Networks’ Info: Pulls detail about multiple discovered networks.
  4. Read a Single Network’s Info: Pulls detail about a specific discovered network.

tags.name: Interface
tags.description:
The Auvik Interface API allows you to view an inventory of device interfaces and other related information discovered by Auvik.

There are two endpoints available within the Interface API.
  1. Read Multiple Interfaces Info: Pulls detail about multiple interfaces associated with your clients’ devices.
  2. Read a Single Interface Info: Pulls detail about a specific interface associated with a client device.

tags.name: Component
tags.description:
The Auvik Component API allows you to view an inventory of device components and other related information discovered by Auvik.

There are two endpoints available within the Component API.
  1. Read Multiple Components’ Info: Pulls detail about multiple components associated with your clients’ devices.
  2. Read a Single Component’s Info: Pulls detail about a specific component associated with a client device.

tags.name: Entity
tags.description:
The Auvik Entity API allows you to view notes and audit trails associated with the entities (devices, networks, and interfaces) that have been discovered by Auvik.

There are four endpoints available within the Entity API.
  1. Read Multiple Entity Audits: Pulls detail about multiple audits associated with client entities.
  2. Read a Single Entity Audit: Pulls detail about a specific audit entry associated with a client entity.
  3. Read Multiple Entity Notes: Pulls detail about multiple notes associated with client entities.
  4. Read a Single Entity Note: Pulls detail about a specific note associated with a client entity.

tags.name: Credentials
tags.description:
The Credentials API allows you to perform operations relating to your API credentials.

There is one endpoint currently available within the Credentials API.
  1. Verify Credentials: Verify that your credentials are correct before making a call to an endpoint.

tags.name: Tenants
tags.description:
The Auvik Tenant API allows you to see if you have access to multi-clients or clients associated to your Auvik user account. The output from the API shows if you have permissions to a multi-client or client, but doesn’t show the associated role permissions.

There are three endpoints within the Tenant API.
  1. Read Multiple Tenants: Pulls access detail about multiple multi-clients and clients associated with your Auvik user account.
  2. Read Multiple Tenants Detail: Pulls details for multiple multi-clients and clients associated with your Auvik user account.
  3. Read single Tenant Detail: Pulls detail for a specific multiple multi-client or client associated with your Auvik user account.

tags.name: Configuration
tags.description:
The Configuration API allows you to view a history of device configurations and other related information discovered by Auvik.

There are two endpoint within the Configuration API.
  1. Read Multiple Configurations. Pulls detail about multiple device configurations associated with your Auvik user account.
  2. Read Single Configuration. Pulls detail about a single device configuration associated with your Auvik user account.

tags.name: Alert History
tags.description:
The Auvik Alert API allows you to view the alert events that has been triggered by your Auvik collector(s).

There are two endpoints available within the Alert API.
  1. Read Multiple Alerts. Read multiple alerts based on query parameters you specify.
  2. Read a Single Alert. Read a specific Alert.

tags.name: Alert
tags.description:
The Auvik Alert API allows you to dismiss an alert that Auvik has triggered.

There is a single endpoint availble within the Alert API.
  1. Dismiss Alert. Dismiss a single alert.

tags.name: Usage
tags.description:
The Auvik Usage API allows to view usage data that Auvik uses to calculate your invoices.

There are two endpoints available in the Usage API.
  1. Read Client Usage Read a summary of a client’s (and client’s children if a multi-client) usage for a given time range.
  2. Read Device Usage Read the usage data of a device for a given period.

tags.name: Statistics
tags.description:
The Auvik Statistics API allows you view some of the entity statistics that Auvik monitors.

There are six endpoints available in the Statistics API.
  1. Read Device Statistics: Provides historical device statistics such as bandwidth, CPU utilization and memory utilization.
  2. Read Device Availability Statistics: Provides historical device uptime and outage statistics.
  3. Read Service Statistics: Provides historical cloud ping check statistics.
  4. Read Interface Statistics: Provides historical interface statistics such as bandwidth and packet loss.
  5. Read Component Statistics: Provides historical statistics for components such as CPUs, disks, fans and memory.
  6. Read OID Statistics: Provides the current value for numeric SNMP Pollers.

tags.name: SNMP Poller
tags.description:
The Auvik SNMP Poller API allows to view SNMP Poller Settings configured in Auvik.

There are three endpoints available in the SNMP Poller API.
  1. Read Multiple SNMP Poller Settings: Provides details about multiple SNMP Poller Settings.
  2. Read Single SNMP Poller Settings: Provides details about a specific SNMP Poller Setting.
  3. Read SNMP Poller Setting's Devices: Provides details about all the devices associated to a specific SNMP Poller Setting.

tags.name: SNMP Poller History
tags.description:
The Auvik SNMP Poller History API allows to view the history of the device's statistics that Auvik polls.

There are two endpoints available in the SNMP Poller History API.
  1. Read String SNMP Poller Setting History: Provides historical values of String SNMP Poller Settings.
  2. Read Numeric SNMP Poller Setting History: Provides historical values of Numeric SNMP Poller Settings.

tags.name: ASM
tags.description: The Auvik SaaS Management API allows you to access all SaaS related data collected via the Auvik SaaS Management product. The Auvik SaaS Management API includes all core data included as a part of the product including Applications, Monitored Users, Security Logs, and other key data.

get.description:
Use the Verify Credentials API to verify your credentials are correct before making a call to an endpoint.

Looking at the detail screen on the right, click cURL to see the command that will be used. Click Copy to copy the details of the command to your clipboard. Be sure to edit the following parameters within the command:
  • Within the API URL, us1.my (https://auvikapi.us1.my.auvik.com) should be updated to match the region in which your account resides. To locate the region, log into your Auvik dashboard and look at the URL in your browser’s address bar.
  • user@example.com should be the email address of a user whose credentials you wish to check.
  • apiKey should be the API key that’s been set for the user.

Use the Read Multiple Devices’ Info API to pull the collected information about the various devices Auvik has discovered. You’ll need the client IDs for the clients you want to run the multiple read against.

To find the client IDs, run the Read Multiple Tenants API.

Looking at the detail screen on the right, click cURL to see the command that will be used. Click Copy to copy the details of the command to your clipboard. Be sure to edit the following parameters within the command:
  • Within the API URL, us1.my (https://auvikapi.us1.my.auvik.com) should be updated to match the region in which your account resides. To locate the region, log into your Auvik dashboard and look at the URL in your browser’s address bar.
  • user@example.com should be the email address of a user with permissions to view device information.
  • apiKey should be the API key that’s been set for the user.
  • 195798545063742726 should be the ID or comma delimited IDs of the client(s) whose data you wish to fetch information from.
  • filter[deviceType]=router should be whichever key and value pair you want to filter the result set by. See below for a list of filterable parameters.

parameters.name: filter[networks]
parameters.description: Filter by IDs of networks this device is on.

parameters.name: filter[deviceType]
parameters.description: Filter by device type.

parameters.name: filter[makeModel]
parameters.description: Filter by the device’s make and model.

parameters.name: filter[vendorName]
parameters.description: Filter by the device’s vendor/manufacturer.

parameters.name: filter[onlineStatus]
parameters.description: Filter by the device’s online status.

parameters.name: filter[modifiedAfter]
parameters.description: Filter by date and time, only returning entities modified after provided value.

parameters.name: filter[notSeenSince]
parameters.description: Filter by the last seen online time, returning entities not seen online after the provided value.

parameters.name: filter[stateKnown]
parameters.description: Filter by devices with recently updated data, for more consistent results.

parameters.name: tenants
parameters.description: Comma delimited list of tenant IDs to request info from.

parameters.name: page[first]
parameters.description: For paginated responses, the first N elements will be returned. Used in combination with page[after].

parameters.name: page[after]
parameters.description: Cursor after which elements will be returned as a page. The page size is provided by page[first].

parameters.name: page[last]
parameters.description: For paginated responses, the last N services will be returned. Used in combination with page[before].

parameters.name: page[before]
parameters.description: Cursor before which elements will be returned as a page. The page size is provided by page[last].

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Use to include the full resource objects of the list device relationships.

parameters.name: fields[deviceDetail]
parameters.description: Use to limit the attributes that will be returned in the included detail object to only what is specified by this query parameter. Requires include=deviceDetail

  • user@example.com should be the email address of a user with permissions to view device information.
  • apiKey should be the API key that’s been set for the user.
  • MTk...2Nw should be the device’s ID.

get.description:
Use the Read Single Device’s Extended Details API to get a device’s extended details. Many device types have information collected and tracked by Auvik that are unique to that device type. Use this endpoint to access such information for a given device.

To find the device IDs, run the Read Multiple Devices API.

Looking at the detail screen on the right, click cURL to see the command that will be used. Click Copy to copy the details of the command to your clipboard. Be sure to edit the following parameters within the command:
  • Within the API URL, us1.my (https://auvikapi.us1.my.auvik.com) should be updated to match the region in which your account resides. To locate the region, log into your Auvik dashboard and look at the URL in your browser’s address bar.
  • user@example.com should be the email address of a user with permissions to view device extended details.
  • apiKey should be the API key that’s been set for the user.
  • MTk...2Nw should be the device’s ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of device

includeDeviceDetailParam.name: include
includeDeviceDetailParam.description: Use to include the full resource objects of the list device relationships.

deviceDetailFieldsParam.name: fields[deviceDetail]
deviceDetailFieldsParam.description: Use to limit the attributes that will be returned in the included detail object to only what is specified by this query parameter. Requires include=deviceDetail

networkScanStatusFilterParam.name: filter[scanStatus]
networkScanStatusFilterParam.description: Filter by the network’s scan status.

networkDevicesFilterParam.name: filter[devices]
networkDevicesFilterParam.description: Filter by IDs of devices on this network. Filter by multiple values by providing a comma delimited list.

parentDeviceIdFilterParam.name: filter[parentDevice]
parentDeviceIdFilterParam.description: Filter by the entity's parent device ID.

onlineStatusFilterParam.name: filter[onlineStatus]
onlineStatusFilterParam.description: Filter by the device’s online status.

modifiedAfterFilterParam.name: filter[modifiedAfter]
modifiedAfterFilterParam.description: Filter by date and time, only returning entities modified after provided value.

notSeenSinceFilterParam.name: filter[notSeenSince]
notSeenSinceFilterParam.description: Filter by the last seen online time, returning entities not seen online after the provided value.

stateKnownFilterParam.name: filter[stateKnown]
stateKnownFilterParam.description: Filter by devices with recently updated data, for more consistent results.

usageFromDateFilterParam.name: filter[fromDate]
usageFromDateFilterParam.description: Date from which you want to query

usageThruDateFilterParam.name: filter[thruDate]
usageThruDateFilterParam.description: Date to which you want to query

includeAsmClientDetailParam.name: include
includeAsmClientDetailParam.description: Use to include extended details of the client.

includeAsmApplicationDetailParam.name: include
includeAsmApplicationDetailParam.description: Use to include extended details of the application or of its related objects.

includeAsmSecurityLogDetailParam.name: include
includeAsmSecurityLogDetailParam.description: Use to include extended details of the security log or of its related objects.

pageFirstParam.name: page[first]
pageFirstParam.description: For paginated responses, the first N elements will be returned. Used in combination with page[after].

pageAfterParam.name: page[after]
pageAfterParam.description: Cursor after which elements will be returned as a page. The page size is provided by page[first].

pageLastParam.name: page[last]
pageLastParam.description: For paginated responses, the last N services will be returned. Used in combination with page[before].

pageBeforeParam.name: page[before]
pageBeforeParam.description: Cursor before which elements will be returned as a page. The page size is provided by page[last].

statFilterFromTimeParam.name: filter[fromTime]
statFilterFromTimeParam.description: Timestamp from which you want to query

statFilterThruTimeParam.name: filter[thruTime]
statFilterThruTimeParam.description: Timestamp to which you want to query (defaults to current time)
